content.body: Hey all, Aki still manages the DNS record for TC39.es and wants to hand it over because it is getting lots of hits and costing her money.
content.formatted_body: Hey all, Aki still manages the DNS record for TC39.es and wants to hand it over because it is getting lots of hits and costing her money.

content.body: Is there a way we can transfer ownership and or reduce costs?
jasew: Maybe you could invite Aki here?
content.formatted_body: jasew: Maybe you could invite Aki here?

more than the yearly domain registration cost?

content.body: I made a spreadsheet of the DNS records I have. I could have sworn I owned the domain but I guess not?
I got enough requests in the last 36 hours that I expect the bill will be about $100
ok so this is just for the DNS server, not domain transfer?
Correct. No clue who owns the domain. Probably ECMA itself? My memory is broken and PayPal deletes emails after 3 years so my information is limited.
content.formatted_body: Correct. No clue who owns the domain. Probably ECMA itself? My memory is broken and PayPal deletes emails after 3 years so my information is limited.

content.body: So basically you’ll need to change the nameservers at the registrar to use either their DNS or someone else on the committee, and then update that DNS with the spreadsheet
Also in my research I discovered I own tc39.org but it’s apparently just parked right now? Happy to transfer it to anyone else, I apparently just renewed it a week ago
